<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Spiritual Sense](/Feats.aspx?ID=1493) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 79 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Exorcist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=171) (Level 8)

</column>

---

You have a vague connection to the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9) that enables you to notice spirits. While you're exploring but not [Searching](/Actions.aspx?ID=519), the GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) check for you to find [haunts](/Traits.aspx?ID=88) that usually require Searching, as well as [spirits](/Traits.aspx?ID=149), creatures on the Ethereal Plane, and beings made entirely of spiritual essence such as [celestials](/Traits.aspx?ID=23), [fiends](/Traits.aspx?ID=70), and [monitors](/Traits.aspx?ID=111).

 You can also potentially notice [ethereal](/Traits.aspx?ID=63) creatures and spirits inside solid objects, provided they are within 30 feet of you. This applies while Searching, while [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=84), and on the automatic secret check you gain while exploring even if you aren't Searching. You can still notice spirits only on a successful check, and you can't see them if they're more than 5 feet inside an object.

 When you notice a creature with your Spiritual Sense, you also learn its location, making it [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) to you if it had been [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39).
name: Spiritual Sense
